newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: S&P rates Citibank's A$500 mln note programme.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates Citibank's A$500 mln note programme.

text.p: Standard & Poor's Corp said on Wednesday it has assigned its AA minus rating to Citibank Ltd's A$500 million transferable certificate of deposit/medium term note programme. The rating outlook is stable.
The rating is predicated on Citibank's ultimate ownership by, and integration with, the U.S.-based Citicorp group, the rating agency said.

The ratings are also supported by Citibank's solid business profile, sound asset quality and funding profile, above average profitability and capitalisation, and conservative liquidity and risk management policies, it said.
Citicorp, rated A plus/A1, is the parent of Citibank N.A., New York, rated AA minus/A1 plus, which in turn owns Citibank Ltd, the largest foreign-owned bank operating in Australia.
The outlook reflected the outlook assigned to the parent company, Citicorp, and the strength and financial flexibility that Citibank derives from its Citicorp group membership, S&P added.
